question_sentence: Which American football team was left out of the 2023 College Football Playoffs despite being undefeated this season?
evidence: The College Football Playoff committee omitted the 13-0 Seminoles after the team's star quarterback suffered a season-ending injury. Critics including Florida's Governor Ron DeSantis have protested against the decision, which marks the first time in CFP's 10-year history that an undefeated major conference team has been left out.

question_sentence: Which podcast became the first ever to be awarded the British Academy President's Medal for services to the humanities?
evidence: The British Academy awarded the prestigious prize to the popular podcast, hosted by Tom Holland and Dominic Sandbrook, for success in "creating a new generation of history enthusiasts". The show is made by Gary Lineker's company Goalhanger Podcasts, and is part of a hit series that includes "The Rest is Entertainment" and "The Rest is Politics".

question_sentence: Which European royal was accused of infidelity with her former brother-in-law?
evidence: Jaime del Burgo, the former husband of the queen's sister Telma, claims to have had an affair with Letizia while she was pregnant with one of her two children by King Felipe. The businessman posted an image on social media on Sunday showing a pregnant Letizia that she allegedly sent to him with a message of love.

question_sentence: Billie Eilish accused which publication of "outing" her?
evidence: Eilish has called for an end to speculation about her sexuality that began when the "Bad Guy" singer suggested during a recent interview for Variety that she was attracted to women. After then being asking at Variety's Hitmakers event whether she had intended to come out, Eilish sarcastically thanked the magazine in an Instagram post for "outing" her "instead of talking about anything else that matters".

question_sentence: Former US diplomat Manuel Rocha is accused of being an undercover agent for more than 40 years for which country?
evidence: Colombia-born Rocha, a former ambassador to Bolivia, served as a "clandestine agent" of Cuba throughout his 20-year career in the State Department and the following two decades, the Justice Department said in charges unsealed on Monday. He was arrested last week following a long-running FBI investigation, and if convicted currently faces up to 10 years in prison, but more charges were expected to be filed.

question_sentence: Proposals for enforcing the UK's Online Safety Act include the mandatory use of facial age estimation technology to check users of what?
evidence: Draft rules from regulator Ofcom would require porn sites to ensure users are over 18 by using age-checking measures including face scans, photo-ID documents and credit card checks. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What is the name of the cheese dubbed the "world's smelliest" set to cause a stink in UK supermarkets?
evidence: The brie-style cheese, available in some Asda stores this Christmas, has an "exotic aroma" of "old feet", according to makers Highland Fine Cheeses. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to The Week's Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which golfer this week became the latest to leave the PGA Tour for the Saudi-funded LIV Golf circuit?
evidence: The Spaniard had previously ruled out joining the Saudi-funded league, which began in 2021. But the world No.3 and two-time major winner changed his mind after agreeing a deal worth a reported £450 million.

question_sentence: How much per year is Britain's obesity problem costing the economy, according to new analysis?
evidence: The research, commissioned by the Tony Blair Institute, found that the damaging effect on national productivity from excess weight was nine times bigger than previously thought. The total estimated cost to the economy is roughly 4% of the UK's GDP.

question_sentence: Which US congressman this week announced his decision to retire from Congress at the end of this year "to serve America in new ways"?
evidence: The California Republican announced his resignation in a newspaper column on Wednesday, two months after becoming the first House speaker in history to be ousted from the role. The imminent departure of McCarthy from Congress, after 17 years in office, will leave his party with a slim 220-213 majority in the chamber.

question_sentence: Where did the fourth Republican presidential debate take place this week?
evidence: Republican candidates faced off Wednesday night in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, in the fourth presidential debate of the 2024 election cycle.

question_sentence: Which popular Christmas song topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart for the first time this week?
evidence: Sixty-five years after it was first released, “Rockin’ Around the Christmas Tree” has topped the Billboard Hot 100 for the first time. That makes the hit song’s original performer, Brenda Lee, now 78, one of the oldest artists to ever top the chart.

question_sentence: Which company is investigating a hack involving millions of user accounts?
evidence: Hackers have accessed nearly 7 million profiles of 23andMe customers, a spokesperson for the genetic testing firm told CNN, including some users’ ancestry reports, zip codes and birth years.

question_sentence: Which carrier is merging with Alaska Airlines?
evidence: Alaska Airlines announced it will buy rival Hawaiian Airlines for $1.9 billion. The unique deal will see both companies keep their existing brands.

question_sentence: Which war-torn region have UN officials recently described as “apocalyptic” with “no place safe to go?”
evidence: The United Nations is warning of an “apocalyptic” situation in Gaza as Israel-Hamas fighting intensifies. CNN has reported on starving residents digging for food and supplies under the rubble amid a deepening humanitarian crisis.

question_sentence: What is the federal minimum wage in the US?
evidence: Twenty states are still using the federal minimum wage of $7.25, which hasn’t gone up since 2009. Twenty-two states are raising their minimum wages on January 1.

question_sentence: Which fast-casual restaurant was hit with another lawsuit this week over caffeinated lemonade?
evidence: Panera’s caffeinated lemonade has allegedly caused some cardiac events, according to at least two lawsuits against the company.

question_sentence: What was the most-viewed page on Wikipedia this year?
evidence: ChatGPT, the viral AI chatbot, was the most-viewed page on Wikipedia this year with nearly 50 million views, reflecting the world’s interest in artificial intelligence.

question_sentence: Which lawmaker announced that he is leaving Congress at the end of this year?
evidence: Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy is resigning from Congress and will leave at the end of this year, he announced in a Wall Street Journal op-ed this week.

question_sentence: Which iconic band recently held its final concert in New York City after 50 years of touring?
evidence: Members of the American rock band KISS said goodbye at their final concert on December 2 at Madison Square Garden — the culmination of 50 years of touring.

question_sentence: Who is considering running for governor in Delaware in 2024?
What prompted an investigation into Wilmington police's reporting of fatal crashes, leading to a change in their reporting practices?
What new concept is Dick's Sporting Goods introducing in Delaware at the Brandywine Town Center?
Which two breweries in the Newark area of Delaware were named among the best Belgian-style brewers in the country at the Great American Beer Festival?
Which Major League Baseball team did Zack Gelof get called up to play for?
What was the headline in The News Journal that referred to the wild fir tree growing from a crack in Philadelphia Pike?
What was the main reason behind Incyte's decision not to move forward with its headquarters expansion in Alapocas?
Why is the Red Clay Consolidated School District planning to "phase-out" Spanish immersion at Marbrook Elementary and Skyline Middle School?
Why is former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visiting the University of Delaware this weekend?
Which telehealth provider recently expanded its services into Delaware, offering consultations for medication abortions, emergency contraceptives, birth control, and treatment for vaginal infections?
